name: unrecognizable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
very different to before, or changed very much, and therefore not able to be recognized: She returned to the United States to find a country that seemed almost unrecognizable from the one she had left as a young woman. He had been beaten so severely that he was unrecognizable.
not clear enough or known well enough to be able to be recognized: The other picture was of an unrecognisable small boy, holding a hand up to the camera. The truck was flying an unrecognizable flag. Compare
recognizable
More examplesFewer examplesHe appears in the movie in a fat suit that renders him unrecognizable.The voice coming out of the phone was unrecognisable as that of O'Neill.I've drawn an arrow on the photo pointing at a tiny, unrecognizable figure way up the street, standing with a bunch of other locals.
